I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

power_mult : forall p a b : nat, expo (a * b) p = expo a (expo b p)
power_plus : forall p a b : nat, expo (a + b) p = expo a p * expo b p
plus_cancel_l : forall a b c : nat, a + b = a + c -> b = c
mprod_factorial_Zp : forall i n : nat, 〚 Π n (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1)) 〛 = 〚 fact n 〛
Newton_nat : forall a b n : nat, expo n (a + b) = msum add 0 (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial n i * expo (n - i) a * expo i b)
rem_plus_div : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a b : nat, divides p b -> rem a p = rem (a + b) p
rem_mult_rem : forall p a b : nat, rem (a * rem b p) p = rem (a * b) p
is_digit = fun c q i y : nat => y < q /\ (exists a b : nat, c = (a * q + y) * expo i q + b /\ b < expo i q) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_digit (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
rem_plus_rem : forall p a b : nat, rem (a + rem b p) p = rem (a + b) p
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, BinNums.N0) | BinNums.Npos na => match b with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, a) | BinNums.Npos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N * BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
mscal_mult : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (a b : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (a * b) x = mscal m u a (mscal m u b x)
Newton_nat_S : forall a n : nat, expo n (1 + a) = msum add 0 (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial n i * expo i a)
binomial_thm : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> fact n = binomial n p * fact p * fact (n - p)
binomial_spec : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> fact n = binomial n p * fact p * fact (n - p)
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
binomial_Newton : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x y : X, sum x y = sum y x) -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : X), times a b = times b a -> mscal times one n (sum a b) = msum sum zero (S n) (fun i : nat => mscal sum zero (binomial n i) (times (mscal times one (n - i) a) (mscal times one i b)))
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
rem_erase : forall q n p r : nat, q = n * p + r -> rem q p = rem r p
mscal_plus : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (a b : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (a + b) x = m (mscal m u a x) (mscal m u b x)
fact_S : forall n : nat, fact (S n) = S n * fact n
utils_list.list_an_plus : forall a n m : nat, utils_list.list_an a (n + m) = utils_list.list_an a n ++ utils_list.list_an (n + a) m
